intro: Hypericopsis elegans, commonly known as the elegant hypericopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Hypericaceae, which includes several species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Hypericopsis elegans is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments.
